page.title: 13A Boarder's Day at Bootham
page.content: Peter Bagnell aged eleven. I am at a boarding school.This means that I live away from home.The school provides my bed and home base.I share a room with three other people.Bed time is at 8.40 pm and rising is at 7.20 am. In my bedroom are bedside lockers(75cms tall),a chair each and a chest of drawers in which I share 1.5 drawers.I go down to breakfast(the first meal) and have a cereal and bacon and eggs.Then I return to make my bed and have it passed by my housemaster at 8am.Then we go to join the other pupils of my age,some of whom are not resident to be checked by our teacher.We assemble in the hall and sit in Quaker silence for 10 minutes.The twenty people in my class(1/3 are girls)then go to lessons.We study French,English,Maths, Latin,History. cont'd p14
